Replace.Text: When the city's population reaches 8 [ICON_Citizen] population each time, all builders produced in the city will get an additional +1 [ICON_Charges] construction times. When reaching 8 [ICON_Citizen] population, city [ICON_Citizen] population is reduced to 1.

Builders get +1 [ICON_Charges] build count. When the population of a city [ICON_Citizen] reaches 8, the city gets a builder. When the population of a city [ICON_Citizen] is 1, all output of the city will be +100%. [NEWLINE] [ICON_Production] Productivity and [ICON_Food] food +15% when the population of the city is 1 [ICON_Citizen], if the city reaches 5 [ICON_Citizen] population, it will be changed to [ICON_Science] technology value and [ICON_Culture] culture value +10%. When the population of a city reaches 8 [ICON_Citizen] each time, the output of the above city will be increased by +5%.

Cities with large populations will be built. Likes a densely populated civilization in the surrounding city [ICON_Citizen]. Dislikes civs with small surrounding city territories and vulnerable loyalty.

The Witch of Envy features an Industrial Activity Zone, replacing the Industrial Zone. [NEWLINE]+4 [ICON_Production] Production after unlocking "Apprentice". When the city's [ICON_Citizen] population reaches 8 each time, all industrial buildings in the city will have an additional +2 [ICON_Production] production capacity. When the city's [ICON_Citizen] population is 1, the area has +4 [ICON_Production] production. [NEWLINE]Provides [ICON_Housing] housing based on cell charm,[COLOR:Red] but is mutually exclusive with neighborhoods and cannot be built in the same city as neighborhoods. [ENDCOLOR]

Witch of Envy unique building, replaces Factory. [NEWLINE]+4 [ICON_Production] Production for all cities within 6 tiles. After researching the "Electricity" technology, the building can add +4 [ICON_Culture] culture value to the city it is in. This bonus can only be applied once in the same city, and building multiple buildings of this type within 6 cells of the city center will not provide additional bonuses.

Start with "Astrology" [ICON_TechBoosted] Eureka. Cities with "Sanctuary" will have the following effects:[NEWLINE]College and Industry buildings can be purchased with [ICON_Faith] Faith. The city gains [ICON_Production] production per turn equal to 30% of the [ICON_Faith] it gains per turn.

A city with a "sanctuary" will have the following effects: every time a mine is adjacent to a mine, the "sanctuary" will have -1 [ICON_Production] production; every time a mine is adjacent to a "sanctuary", the mine will have +1 [ICON_Production] production and [ICON_Culture] culture.
Striving to create industries, favoring civs that also focus on [ICON_Production] production.

The characteristic industrial activity area of ​​the Greedy Witch, which replaces the industrial area and is cheaper to build, unlocked by astrology. The [ICON_Production] Production adjacency bonus in the [NEWLINE] area also grants [ICON_Faith] Faith. [NEWLINE][ICON_GreatProphet] The Great Prophet can create a religion in Sanctuary. Can trigger a culture bomb. [COLOR:Red] is mutually exclusive with the Holy Land, and cannot be built in the same city as the Holy Land. [ENDCOLOR]
The Lust Witch unique building, which replaces the Workshop. [NEWLINE]Purchase of missionaries is allowed. Can only be purchased with [ICON_Faith] Faith.

Lust Witch unique building, replaces Factory. [NEWLINE]Its [ICON_Production] production bonus extends to all city centers within 6 tiles that do not receive this building type bonus. [NEWLINE]Allows the purchase of Apostles, Gurus, Inquisitors, and, if of the corresponding faith, Monks. These units can only be purchased with [ICON_Faith] Faith.

If war is declared, +165% [ICON_Production] Production (decreases by 33% every three turns). [NEWLINE]Buildings in Fist of Wrath gain +2 [ICON_Production] Production and give cities +10% [ICON_Production] Production whenever you are not at war with any civilizations.

When a battle occurs, heal all damage and consume [ICON_Faith] Faith in proportion to the damage. Whenever the cure effect is triggered, there is a certain chance that various natural disasters will occur. [NEWLINE]Units are immune to natural disasters.
If he would be branded a belligerent because of this war, he would never declare war and try to help those who keep the peace. Hate militants.

The Wrathful Witch's characteristic industrial activity area, which replaces the industrial area, is unlocked earlier and the cost is lower. [NEWLINE]Can increase the health regeneration of adjacent units. If other units start to move from the Fist of Wrath, they can get 1 point of [ICON_Movement] movement bonus. [NEWLINE]The Fist of Wrath is a defensive area with ranged attack capabilities, [COLOR:Red] but it is mutually exclusive with the camp and cannot be built in the same city as the camp. [ENDCOLOR]

Wrath Witch unique building that replaces the Power Plant. Ignores normal tech requirements, shows [ICON_RESOURCE_URANIUM] uranium resources. [NEWLINE]Automatically convert any amount of [ICON_RESOURCE_URANIUM] Uranium into [ICON_Power] Electricity and power cities within 6 cells at a rate of:[NEWLINE][ICON_Bullet]1[ICON_RESOURCE_URANIUM]Uranium[ICON_PowerRight]16 [ICON_Power] Electricity. [NEWLINE][ICON_Bullet] emits tiny amounts of CO2 into the atmosphere[NEWLINE]Its [ICON_Production] Productivity and [ICON_Science] Science bonuses extend to all City Centers within 6 tiles that do not receive Power Plant building bonuses.
+{1_num} [ICON_Science] Science value, from adjacent Volcano tiles.
+{1_num} [ICON_Production] Production from adjacent coast and lake tiles.
+{1_num} [ICON_Culture] Culture value from adjacent coast and lake tiles.

+5 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength when a military unit is fighting in a frozen or snow cell. Does not suffer combat debuffs when injured. [NEWLINE]Enemy unit -1 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength after fighting an enemy unit. Extra -1 [ICON_Movement] movement every three times.
+5 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength when fighting in a frozen or snow cell. Does not suffer combat debuffs when injured.

The [ICON_Production] Production adjacency bonus for areas on permafrost and snow also provides [ICON_Science] science. Each Tundra or Tundra Hills tile within 3 tiles of the city's territory gives the city +1 [ICON_Faith] Faith and +1 [ICON_Production] Production per Snow or Snow Hills tile above Double the output and provide +1 [ICON_Science] technology value and +1 [ICON_Culture] culture value. [NEWLINE]When encountering a snowstorm, there is a certain chance that the frozen soil and snow cells of the city you belong to will get +1 [ICON_Food] Food, +1 [ICON_Faith] Faith, or +1 [ICON_Culture] Culture.

Unless the other party fails to keep its diplomatic commitments, it will not take the initiative to attack its neighbors. Likes civilizations that live in peace with their neighbors, and dislikes civilizations that go to war with their neighbors.

The Frozen Witch's characteristic industrial activity area, which replaces the industrial area, is unlocked earlier and the cost is lower. [NEWLINE]Buildings in the academy gain [ICON_Science] science equal to [ICON_Production] production, +1 [ICON_Science] science from each snow or snow hills tile in the city, [COLOR:Red] However, it is mutually exclusive with the college and cannot be built in the same city as the college. [ENDCOLOR]
+{1_num} [ICON_Production] Production from adjacent Tundra Hills tiles.
+{1_num} [ICON_Production] Production from the adjacent natural wonder Great Barrier Reef.
+{1_num} [ICON_Production] Production from adjacent natural wonder Pamukkale.
+{1_num} [ICON_Production] Production from adjacent Geothermal Fissure cells.

Emilia's characteristic hero unit, only one can be owned at a time, and has a unique reinforcement tree. Can only be purchased with [ICON_Faith] Faith. [NEWLINE]Unable to gain experience points, as Chief Executive Parker's title is enhanced. [NEWLINE]Gain +1 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength for every third attack, up to a maximum of 15 Combat Strength from this effect per era. [NEWLINE] When attacking, if you have enough Faith Points (era parameters × 200), there is a certain chance to consume Faith Points to summon Blizzard.
Gain +1 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength for every third attack, up to 15 Combat Strength from this effect per era. Gain an additional +1 attack count each time a boost is acquired.
Learn to control the area, adjacent enemy units -5 [ICON_Strength] combat power and -1 [ICON_Movement] movement power.
+10 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength when defending against attacks from melee units. +7 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength when defending against ranged or flanking attacks.
The Power of the Water Spirit
Only adjacent enemy units can spot this unit. After defeating an enemy unit, gain [ICON_Faith] Faith equal to 50% of its basic [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength. (at standard game speed)
100% efficiency when attacking cities and camps from a distance, no combat debuffs when damaged.

[COLOR_RED] When the Ice Witch is killed, she will appear at the scene of death, attacking regardless of enemy or friend. [ENDCOLOR]. New Ice Witches cannot be purchased while Last Beast of Permafrost is in play.
[COLOR:Red] is cooling down[ENDCOLOR] ({1_iAmount} more rounds needed).
Summons a blizzard at the current location.

Emilia's characteristic chief executive, who can be assigned to foreign city-states like a diplomat. Has the ability to debuff the area to assist in defending the city and enhance the output of frozen soil and snow cells. The special unit "Ice Witch" is provided, and the corresponding position of "Ice Witch" can be strengthened at the same time when it is upgraded.

-5 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength and -1 [ICON_Movement] Movement Strength for enemy units within 3 tiles of the city center. [NEWLINE]The cost of buying tiles for this city in Snow, Tundra, Snow Hills, and Tundra Hills terrain is halved.

The halo effect of "The Last Beast of Permafrost" is extended by three cells, and units within the range can obtain additional [ICON_Faith] Faith Points when they plunder improvement facilities and areas. [NEWLINE]Regions on or adjacent to frozen soil or snow tiles get +2 [ICON_Food] food and [ICON_Production] production, and +2 [ICON_Culture] culture if they are on or adjacent to snow tiles.
The aura effect of 'The Last Beast of Permafrost' is extended by three cells. The attacks of the units within the range can cause complete damage to the city walls.
The aura effect of "The Last Beast of Permafrost" is doubled.
Frozen soil and snow cells with resources in this city get doubled resource corresponding bonuses, and +1 [ICON_Faith] faith value.

The improved frozen soil and snow tiles in this city get double the corresponding bonus of improvements. If there are 6 frozen soil or snow tiles within 3 tiles of the city, all of which are in the player's territory, the city gets +10% [ICON_Production] Production. If it is snow, then add +10% [ICON_Culture] cultural value.
[COLOR:ResGoldLabelCS]Re: Life in a Different World From Zero[ENDCOLOR]-[COLOR_RED]Witch Tea Party[ENDCOLOR]
Added leaders and civilizations from Re:ZERO -Starting Life in Another World: The Great Sin Witch+α
Added leaders and civilizations from Re:ZERO -Starting Life in Another World: The Great Sin Witch+α
Hemmelfort's B station series of teaching videos and MOD auxiliary tools have benefited a lot

I love you - it's you who give me light, it's you who hold my hand in the dark and show me the world outside, it's you who hold my hand and stay with me in my lonely and timid nights . It's you, tell me with a kiss that I've never been alone. I willfully got too much from you... So, I love you because, because you gave me everything.
I am a witch, an evil witch who occasionally does good. ——Ah, why does love decrease?
My fist can regenerate the world! My wrath will cleanse the world! ! my anger! The soothing of this fist! That's my answer --! !

She has a slender figure, beautiful silver hair that cascades down like a waterfall, and blue-purple eyes. She wears a black dress made of shadows, which seems to fluctuate slightly with the beating of her heart.

The appearance is a combination of white and black, and the beauty of sternness and elegance is almost vividly displayed. She has white hair reaching her waist and a snow-white complexion, and always wears a pure black skirt, rarely choosing more casual attire; she often wears a black butterfly-shaped hairpin; her pupils are dark black, and there are human beings in her eyes The radiance of intelligence that cannot be possessed.

Described as a beautiful, slender girl. Her shiny golden ponytail fell to one side of her cheek. Her clear eyes are almost transparent blue. She is wearing a short skirt for movement and a tunic on a white base. Minerva is short in stature, but she has ample breasts and hips, which make her figure attractive. She gives an impression of health and vitality.

A beautiful girl with long straight silver hair and cyanotic eyes. Silver-haired appearance and half-fairy blood have the same image as the "envious" witch-Shatila, so she is feared by the people of Lugnica.
The representative of 'jealousy' in 'The Witch of Mortal Sin'.
Pursuing all the wisdom in the world, even after death, she is reluctant to give up and pursues all the knowledge of the "Witch of Greed".

The ability is to heal, and the principle is to distort the cause and effect to hurt, which will make the mana in the world unbalanced, and make natural disasters and changes more likely to occur. Therefore, it can be said that every time a person is cured, the world is a little closer to destruction.

Possesses the excellent quality of being an elf warlock, signed a contract with the great elf Parker, and at the same time will use the power of many micro elves. He is good at using fire-attribute magic that manipulates heat to create ice cones, ice walls, etc. to fight. But with the help of the power of the micro-elves, all the magic of the four elements of earth, water, fire and wind can be used.
The sect that is considered by the world to worship the [Witch of Envy] was founded 400 years ago.
There are archbishops of great sin who are called arrogance, anger, sloth, lust, gluttony, and lust. But now the seat of [Arrogance] is vacant.
Act according to the instructions of the [Gospel]. The purpose is to let the [Witch of Jealousy] come down, and I am constantly looking for a suitable container.
In order to achieve the goal by any means, it often takes the lives of innocent people and causes a large number of casualties, so it is considered a symbol of malice in the world.
